page.title: 04Pine Tree Farm
page.content: The farm consists of about 80 acres of pastureland on which ,at present,53 Friesian cows are grazed. Mr. Stott takes a hay and silage crop from some of the 15 fields but grows no other crops. As he does not raise his own heifers,which requires 3 years' advance planning,Mr. Stott has not been badly affected by the new E.E.C. milk quotas. Water for the farm comes from a small reservoir which provides water ror several farms in the area. There are over 50 chickens on the farm but the eggs are for the family's own use or are sold privately. In one of the fields there is a round barrow and legend has it that the Celts fought the local,Saxon, population and were heavily defeated, fleeing to Devon and Cornwall.All the dead are supposedly buried in the round barrow.
